programme.title: DARATT
programme.desc: When the government announces an amnesty for all war criminals, 16-year-old Atim's grandfather gives him a revolver and tells him to find his father's killer. The teenager loses no time in tracking him down.

programme.title: ANGELA
programme.desc: A Cuban immigrant tries to find her place in New York City.

programme.title: PENS 1 Men of Power
programme.desc: Amid Houston’s museums, historic landmarks, and vibrant nightlife exists a cache of the nation’s most prolific spoken word artists.

programme.desc: Amid Houston’s museums, historic landmarks, and vibrant nightlife exists a cache of the nation’s most prolific spoken word artists.

programme.title: THE BLACK MOZART IN CUBA
programme.desc: The Black Mozart in Cuba is the latest act in the rehabilitation of the memory of this extraordinary human being.

programme.title: Zora Neale Hurston: Jump At The Sun
programme.desc: Zora Neale Hurston: Jump at the Sun is a moving interpretation of Zora Neale Hurston's life and career.

programme.title: BLACK GIRL IN PARIS
programme.desc: When a down on her luck aspiring writer runs out of money after moving to Paris, she meets a street-smart prostitute who takes her on a whirlwind adventure of passion, self-discovery and uninhibited sexual freedom.

programme.title: BEALE STREET BLUES
programme.desc: A documentary about the African American bllues artists struggling to keep playing on Beale Street in Memphis, TN.

programme.title: FLY BY LIGHT - REUNION
programme.desc: In 2015, the award-winning documentary Fly By Light followed youth from Washington, DC for three years as they went underwent a powerful peace education program that culminated in a 7-day overnight retreat in the mountains of West Virginia.

programme.title: ELEPHANT IN THE ROOM
programme.desc: A former, female boxing champion and her business partner coach are mentoring two teenage girls, best friends through their non-profit gym.

programme.title: Zora Neale Hurston: Jump At The Sun
programme.desc: Zora Neale Hurston: Jump at the Sun is a moving interpretation of Zora Neale Hurston's life and career.

programme.title: HOOPS AFRICA
programme.desc: A collection of stories that celebrates the past, present, and future of basketball in Africa, spotlighting the sport's impact on society and its development on the continent.

programme.title: ARISTIDE
programme.desc: Examines the 2004 coup in Haiti that lead to the removal of President Jean-Bertrand Aristide

programme.title: WALK WITH ME
programme.desc: Walk With Me follows three women who use theater to inspire, stir and animate our democracy. While at work in prisons, schools and community centers, the film reveals that one person â€“ one artist â€“ can make a difference.

programme.title: THE BILL
programme.desc: Lena and ten other women could not be more excited to celebrate Barbie's 35th birthday. When an unexpectedly huge bill arrives, the happy birthday dissolves into drama.

programme.desc: R.C. struggles in his job hunting due to the lack of one crucial skill while desperately attempting to pay off his debts.'

programme.title: DREAMTOWN
programme.desc: DreamTown is a documentary about the precarious dream of a young Afro-Ecuadorian soccer player, Anibal Chala, as he strives to make it to the professional leagues, and eventually sees his dreams become reality.

programme.title: DOO DOO'S REVENGE
programme.desc: Doo Doo’s Revenge compels us to ask the questions: at what age did I have learn to swallow my hurt? Would I do what Doo Doo did?

programme.title: Gonzo Episode 1
programme.desc: A drama that follows the struggles of black college students and their efforts to make reform on their university campus. But once there is a clash in ideology between the schoolâ€™s Black Student Organization and Gonzo, Gonzo is pressured to step up, take charge, and be the voice of the schoolâ€™s black student body.

programme.title: The Beginning And Ending Of Everything EP1
programme.desc: Angelita returns home from prison in hopes of reuniting with the young child she left behind. When she discovers the child is nowhere to be found, she goes on a quest to find the baby, her hope, and her reason for living.
